title: Define Project Requirements
description: This RFC aims to comprehensively gather and document the requirements for the MetricAnomalyDetector system. The system will monitor various types of metrics (system, application, network), prioritizing preferred anomaly detection algorithms based on accuracy and computational efficiency (such as Isolation Forest, One-Class SVM, or Long Short-Term Memory networks). It is expected to handle large data sets and high concurrency, while adhering to data storage and retention policies considering compliance regulations. The user interface will include real-time monitoring, customizable alerts, and historical trend analysis. Security and privacy concerns will be addressed by implementing encryption, access controls, anonymization techniques. Integration with existing monitoring and alerting systems (like Prometheus, Grafana, or Nagios) is considered. Accessibility standards (WCAG 2.1 AA compliance) will be followed. The document will outline assumptions and limitations, and it's recommended to consider cloud-based solutions for improved scalability and cost efficiency. Upon completion, this document will serve as a foundation for the design and development phases of the project. The RFC is currently in DRAFT state, awaiting further input or refinement. Please note that while machine learning techniques are essential, it's crucial to ensure their interpretability and explainability for better understanding and trust-building with users.
